de.jannlab.core

Class BidirectionalNetBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.jannlab.core.NetBase
      • de.jannlab.core.RecurrentNetBase
        • de.jannlab.core.BidirectionalNetBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Net, Serializable, Cloneable

    public final class BidirectionalNetBase
extends RecurrentNetBase
    This class is a specific implementation for bidirectional networks. It computes all times steps per layer and inverts the computing direction for REVERSED layer.

    Author:
    Sebastian Otte
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • BidirectionalNetBase

        public BidirectionalNetBase(NetStructure structure,
                    NetData data)
        Creates an instance of this class by a given NetStructure and NetData instance. The given NetStructure should fulfill the requirements of an bidirectional (offline) RNN, otherwise the correct behavior of the network could not be assured and is assumed as undefined.

        Parameters:
        structure - The given net structure containing the topology and functional specification.
        data - Instance of NetData containing data buffer and weights and must fit the NetStructure.

    • Method Detail

      • compute

        public final void compute()
        Computes the activation of the network. The method strongly depends on the underlying network implementation (online vs. offline).

      • computeGradient

        public final void computeGradient()
        Computes the gradient (error flow) of the network. The method strongly depends on the underlying network implementation (online vs. offline).
